titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Howard Scott Labor Ephemera Collection, 1894-2004 AIS.1999.09
titlestmt.author: Zachary Brodt.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:40:53 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Howard Scott Labor Ephemera Collection
did.abstract: This collection includes photographs, ephemera, buttons and badges purchased by Howard Scott to create a comprehensive body of artifacts documenting working class culture in western Pennsylvania during the twentieth century.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Howard Scott in June 1999 and February 2006.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection includes photographs, ephemera, buttons and badges which represent working class culture in western Pennsylvania during the twentieth century. Unions represented in this collection include: United Electrical, Radio & Machine Workers of America; United Auto Workers; Service Employees International Union; United Mine Workers of America; Brotherhood of Teamsters; and various western Pennsylvania union locals. The American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations are also represented, both before and after their 1955 merger. Throughout the finding aid, descriptions in quotations signify textual incriptions on the actual item.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: These materials were purchased by Howard Scott through private individuals at flea markets, antique shows, and various sales before being acquired by the University of Pittsburgh.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: This collection includes items documenting working class culture in western Pennsylvania collected by Howard Scott. Scott purchased these pins, buttons, badges, ribbons, and ephemera at flea markets, antique shows, and various sales before selling them to the University of Pittsburgh, making them available for research use.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection has been arranged into the following series:

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Howard Scott Labor Ephemera Collection, 1894-2004, AIS.1999.09, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Howard Scott Labor Ephemera Collection, 1894-2004, AIS.1999.09, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Zachary Brodt in April 2011.

controlaccess.subject: Labor
Labor unions -- Pennsylvania -- Pittsburgh
controlaccess.corpname: United Electrical, Radio and Machine Workers of America
International Brotherhood of Teamsters, Chauffeurs, Warehousemen, and Helpers of America
International Union, United Automobile Workers of America (A.F. of L.)

did.unittitle: Ephemera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series includes postcards depicting labor unions, leaders, and work places throughout the Pittsburgh area. Also included are pamphlets and fliers regarding meetings and elections. Union membership cards and dues books are present, as well as letters from a soldier who was deployed to the 1894 coal miners' strike in Wallston, Pennsylvania.

Photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series includes photographs depicting activites of steel and mine workers' unions. Also included are several unlabeled photographs of workers and immigrants.

did.unittitle: Photograph Prints

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains photographs documenting the beginnings of the mine and steel workers unions. Also included are several unlabeled photos depicting immigrants at Ellis Island, African American workers, convention delegates and labor uprisings.

did.unittitle: Eastern Pennsylvania UMWA Picket against Gangloff Bros. and P.P.&L.

Dairymen Delivering Milk Under Police Escort During the Pittsburgh Milk Strike
William Z. Foster and Mother Jones in a Group of Steel Organizers during the Steel Strike
Oversize Photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries is comprised of two oversize photographs. The first depicts Philip Murray, president of the United Steelworkers of America, addressing the eleventh annual District 7 conference in 1951. The other photograph shows the members of the Steelworkers Organizing Committee in 1944.

did.unittitle: Philip P. Murray-11th Annual United Steelworkers of America District 7 Conference
Steel Workers Organizing Committee
Badges and Pins

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series includes buttons, pins and badges that would have been worn by the workers in western Pennsylvania. National and local union buttons and badges from conventions, labor strikes, and celebrations, such as Labor Day, are represented, as well as those reflecting the payment of union dues. Also included are campaign buttons for union, local and presidential elections.
